passage:
(1) On July 20, 1969, humans accomplished one of the most remarkable achievements in history – landing on the surface of the moon. The Apollo 11 mission, commanded by Neil Armstrong, along with Buzz Aldrin and Michael Collins, marked the culmination of years of scientific research, technological innovation, and human determination. This event not only demonstrated what humans could achieve through cooperation and perseverance but also changed how we view our place in the universe.

(2) The journey to the moon began when President John F. Kennedy declared in 1961 that the United States would land a man on the moon before the end of the decade. This ambitious goal required the development of new technologies, spacecrafts, and equipment that had never been created before. Thousands of scientists, engineers, and technicians worked tirelessly to design and build the rockets, command modules, and lunar landing modules necessary for the mission.

(3) After launching from Earth on July 16, 1969, the Apollo 11 spacecraft traveled for three days before entering lunar orbit. On July 20, Armstrong and Aldrin boarded the lunar module 'Eagle' and separated from the command module 'Columbia,' where Collins remained. As the Eagle descended toward the lunar surface, Armstrong had to manually guide the module past a field of boulders to find a safe landing spot, while fuel supplies were running dangerously low.

(4) At 20:17 UTC, Armstrong's voice crackled through the radio: "Houston, Tranquility Base here. The Eagle has landed." Hours later, Armstrong became the first human to step onto the lunar surface, uttering the famous words: "That's one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind." Aldrin joined him shortly after, and together they spent about two and a half hours collecting samples, taking photographs, and setting up experiments on the moon's surface.

(5) The successful moon landing changed how humanity saw itself and what we believed was possible. More than 600 million people – about one-fifth of the world's population at the time – watched the historic broadcast. The mission demonstrated the incredible potential of human ingenuity and cooperation. The footprints left by Armstrong and Aldrin still remain on the moon's surface today, preserved in the lunar dust where there is no wind to erase them – a lasting testament to this remarkable human achievement.

questions.question: Which tense should be used to fill the blank? She _____ to Paris three times before she moved there.

options.A: has been

questions.question: Choose the correct verb form to complete sentence: If the new laboratory equipment arrives on schedule next week, the scientists _____ their experiment immediately.

options.A: start

questions.question: Select the grammatically correct sentence:

options.A: Neither the students nor the teacher are ready.
options.B: Neither the students nor the teacher is ready.
options.C: Neither the students nor the teacher will ready.
options.D: Neither the students nor the teacher have been ready.

questions.question: Choose the correct passive form: They build new houses in this area every year.

options.A: New houses are being building in this area every year.
options.B: New houses are being built in this area every year.
options.C: New houses have been built in this area every year.
options.D: New houses built in this area every year.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the modal verb correctly?

options.A: You must to arrive before 9 PM.
options.C: They might be late for dinner.

questions.question: Choose the correct comparative phrase to complete the sentence: Running a marathon is significantly _____ preparing for a short sprint competition.

options.A: more challenging than

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: He's been working _____ this company _____ 2015.

options.A: for/from

questions.question: Choose the correct relative pronoun to complete the sentence: The newly published study, _____ details were reported in the newspaper, contradicted previous findings.

options.A: who

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: I wish I _____ how to swim when I was younger.

options.A: learned

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct article usage:

options.A: She has a uncle who lives in Australia.
options.B: They went to the Europe for their honeymoon.
options.C: I need to buy an umbrellas for the rainy season.
options.D: He is the best player in the team.

options.A: John goes never to the gym on Sundays.
options.B: Maria always is happy to see her friends.
options.C: They are late sometimes for class.
options.D: We usually have dinner at 7 PM.

questions.question: Choose the correct question tag: You like coffee, _____?

options.A: aren't you

questions.question: Select the correct form: By the time we arrived, the movie _____.

options.A: has been already started

questions.question: Which sentence uses the correct word order?

options.A: Yesterday went we to the beach.
options.D: What time do you will arrive?

questions.question: Choose the correct verb form to complete sentence: If I knew the answer to the complex question, I _____ definitely tell you immediately.

options.A: will

questions.question: Choose the correct phrasal verb to complete the sentence: 'The school had to _____ the annual sports day entirely because of the heavy rain.'

options.A: call off

questions.question: Select the correct idiom to complete the sentence: The exam was very difficult, but John passed with _____ .

options.A: piece of cake

questions.question: Choose the most appropriate verb: You must _____ your homework before you can join your friends for the evening activity.

options.A: make

questions.question: Which word is the odd one out?

options.A: plate

questions.question: Complete the sentence with the correct expression: It's important to _____ the rules of the game before you start playing.

options.A: get by heart

questions.question: Choose the correct fixed expression: The company is very successful _____ the economic crisis.

options.A: in spite of

questions.question: Select the word that best completes the sentence: We were all _____ when we heard the tragic news.

options.A: depressed

questions.question: Which sentence contains an error?

options.A: She has lived in London during three years.
options.B: They have known each other for a long time.
options.C: I haven't seen him since last Monday.

questions.question: Choose the best word to complete the sentence: After climbing the mountain, we were completely _____.

options.A: exhausted

questions.question: Select the correct linking word: She studied hard, _____ she failed the exam.

options.A: so

questions.question: Which definition best describes the word 'suit'?

options.A: A type of hat worn for special occasions
options.C: A verb meaning to appropriate for someone
options.D: An illegal claim brought to court

options.A: We plan to move our house next week.
options.B: The police asked everyone to move from the area.
options.C: She moves a cup of coffee every morning.
options.D: They will move on the party until next month.

options.A: To entertain an audience

options.A: I need to research my keys that I lost yesterday.
options.B: She researched a delicious meal for dinner in a restaurant.
options.C: They're researching the effects of social media on teenagers.

options.A: Can you handle me that book, please?
options.B: The teacher handled the class very well.
options.C: I need to handle my homework by tomorrow.
options.D: They handled a luggage to the airport on time.

options.A: He manages groceries in the local supermarket.
options.B: They managed at finishing the project on time.

options.A: I will go to view the London next summer.

options.A: The judge celebrated the criminal to ten years in prison.
options.B: They judged over the mountain yesterday.
options.C: She judged her homework every evening.
options.D: Don't judge a book by its cover.

options.A: A physical trip from one place to another

options.B: He likes to keep his car clean.

options.C: I need time to reflect on your proposal.

options.A: The river is the main source of water for the town.
options.B: We need to source the problem before fixing it.

options.A: Can you take me to the airport?
options.B: She takes piano lessons twice a week.
options.C: It will take about two hours to complete the task.
options.D: They take the train to work every day in the winter.

options.A: I love the design of this building.

options.D: This design won first prize in the competition.

questions.question: According to the passage, when did humans first land on the moon?
Who was NOT mentioned as an astronaut on the Apollo 11 mission?

options.A: Neil Armstrong

questions.question: What challenge did Armstrong face while landing the lunar module?

options.A: The module was damaged
options.D: Navigating past boulders with low fuel

questions.question: What was the name of the lunar module?

options.A: Apollo 11

questions.question: According to the passage, approximately how many people watched the moon landing broadcast?

options.A: One-fifth of the world's population

questions.question: What did President Kennedy declare in 1961?

options.A: That the Apollo 11 mission would be launched
options.B: That the United States would build the Eagle lunar module
options.C: That Neil Armstrong would be the first person on the moon
options.D: That humans would land on the moon before the end of the decade

questions.question: How long did Armstrong and Aldrin spend on the moon's surface?

options.A: Three days

questions.question: Which of the following best describes what Armstrong and Aldrin did on the moon?

options.A: Built permanent structures of the moon surface
options.B: Planted the American flag and released some helium ballooons
options.C: Collected samples, took photographs, and set up experiments

questions.question: According to the passage, why are the astronauts' footprints still preserved on the moon?

options.A: They were made of special materials
options.C: There is no wind on the moon to erase them
options.D: They were intentionally preserved as a monument

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the passage?

options.A: To explain the scientific benefits and dangers of the first moon landing
options.B: To describe the historical significance of the first moon landing
options.C: To compare the Apollo 11 mission with other space missions
options.D: To detail the technical aspects of the moon spacecraft design
